intro: Hieracium gracilicaule, commonly known as slender stemmed hawkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its slender stems and basal leaves are covered in fine hairs, and it produces yellow flowers in late summer. Hieracium gracilicaule is often found in open habitats and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
